issue.title: Java 9+

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Java 9 issues:
- Core:
   - [x] Unable to add PKCS#11 certs with Java 9+ (#4147)
   - [x] Unable to import ZAP Root CA Cert from PEM file with Java 9+ (#4166)
   - [x] Address deprecation in driver/cert related classes (#4370)
   - [x] Address deprecation in HighlighterManager class (#4385)
   - [x] Size of the configuration file keeps increasing each time ZAP is started with Java 9+ (#4194)
 - Add-ons:
   - [ ] Update JRuby library (#3944)
   - [x] SOAP Scanner add-on leads to errors with Java 9+ (#4037)
   - [x] Source Code Disclosure (WEB-INF folder) fails with Java 9+ (#4038)
   - [x] Unable to create reports with Export Report add-on and Java 9+ (#4214)
   - [x] SAML add-on leads to errors with Java 9+ (#5032)
   - [x] Jython [illegal reflective access](https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/issues/2602#issuecomment-564565232) (zaproxy/zap-extensions#2464)
   - [x] Groovy [illegal reflective access](https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/issues/2602#issuecomment-564565232)
   - [x] Report Generation add-on reflective access (https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/issues/2602#issuecomment-947899477)
------------------
Original report:
------------------
Zap fails with new Java 9:

```
~/ZedAttackProxy/zap250$ ./zap.sh
./zap.sh: linha 49: [: 9-ea: esperado expressão de número inteiro
Exiting: ZAP requires a minimum of Java 7 to run, found 9-ea
```

issue.title: Fix import of root CA cert from PEM with Java 9

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change SslCertificateUtils to use java.util.Base64 to do the Base64
decoding instead of javax.xml.bind.DatatypeConverter, the latter is not
included by default in Java 9. Also, replace usage of Codec Base64 with
the java.util one.
Add tests to assert the expected behaviour.

Fix #4166 - Unable to import ZAP Root CA Cert from PEM file with Java 9

issue.title: Unable to import Root CA certificate for Dynamic SSL Certificates

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
I am attempting to import the Root CA that my company uses on our production proxies for transparent SSL decryption. The certificate is stored in a pem file with the unencrypted private key in the format outline in the user guide entry for Dynamic SSL Certificates. I have used this certificate with MITMProxy before and it works. I have tried this with an alternative CA that I have confirmed works and it yields the same result.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open the Options menu and select the menu entry for "Dynamic SSL Certificates."
2. Click import and confirm "Yes" to overwrite existing certificate.
3. Navigate to the directory containing the certificate, select the certificate file and click "Open."
4. No warnings or alerts are presented by the GUI, but the certificate is not imported.
5. See error and additional context.

**Expected behavior**
Expected the certificate to be imported and to appear in the certificate preview window of the application. In the case that there was an error importing the certificate, expected to receive a warning, alert, or other indication from the GUI.

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Software versions**
 - ZAP: 2.7.0 (installed from Linux package)
 - OS: Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS
 - Java: openjdk version "10.0.2" 2018-07-17
 - Browser: N/A

**Errors from the zap.log file**

29560 [AWT-EventQueue-0] ERROR org.zaproxy.zap.ZAP$UncaughtExceptionLogger  - Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-0"
